}} The '2008â09 Football League Cup', known as the Carling Cup due to the
competition's sponsorship by lager brand Carling, was the 49th season of the
Football League Cup, a knockout competition for England's top 92 football clubs.
The winners qualified for the third qualifying round of the 2009â10 UEFA Europa
League, if not already qualified for European competition.

Manchester United won the competition by defeating defending champions Tottenham
Hotspur on penalties in the final on 1 March 2009.
categories: 2008–09 domestic association football cups|Football League Cup, 2008-09
